children.html:
Stack Overflow is a Q&A site for programmers. 
        It has become almost indispensable as the main source of knowledge for many programmers in their daily work. 
        It is also one of the best examples of online gamification of reputation.
        The way people can collect points, badges, etc ... is keeping them hooked on boosting their public profile little by little
        by participating in the website. And the scores act as a vanity metric that one can use to boast in front of other programmers.
        Jon Skeet has had the #1 spot in Stack Overflow's leaderboard for years. Thanks to this, he has become a celebrity in the 
        world of programming, thus showing the great importance that people place in online reputation metrics.

title: Jon Skeet: The 'Chuck Norris' of programming
